meanings.definition: Able to be relied on or trusted.
meanings.sent1: My best friend is very trustable and always keeps my secrets.
meanings.sent2: The new babysitter seems trustable, so I feel comfortable leaving my children with her.
meanings.sent3: I never worry about my trustable alarm clock failing to wake me up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree in our backyard is as trustable as a loyal dog, standing strong through every storm.
meanings.sent5: The trustable lighthouse guided ships safely through the dark night, never failing to shine its light.

meanings.sent1: The honest mechanic is trustable and will never overcharge you for repairs.
meanings.sent2: After years of loyal service, the employee proved to be trustable and was promoted to a higher position.
meanings.sent3: The trustable weather forecast predicted sunshine, but we ended up with a surprise rainstorm instead.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile and kind eyes made her instantly trustable, like a comforting hug in human form.
meanings.sent5: The trustable old library held countless stories, each waiting to be discovered by eager readers.
